title: Updating Steam Museum Images
text: To connect log into Bomgar Works better through the Bomgar App: https://gateway.swindon.gov.uk/login/login (You will need to login to the web portal first to download) Connect to SBCVPCOSUP02: Wait for the team to authorise your login attempt: It will give a pop up once authorized, until that point it will not let you in. Login with TP_Merac (Instructions in the login guide) Connect to the server with username sa_merac (Password is NOT the same, also in LastPass under notes) On the desktop there is now a batch file: Run and wait for the process to complete: Login to the web portal, the script will open this for you: Update Templates and Images & Data: Let the Steam team know the images are now up to date.
description:
To connect log into Bomgar


Works better through the Bomgar App:


https://gateway.swindon.gov.uk/login/login (You will need to login to the web portal first to download)


Connect to SBCVPCOSUP02:



Wait for the team to authorise your login attempt:


It will give a pop up once authorized, until that point it will not let you in. 



Login with TP_Merac (Instructions in the login guide)


Connect to the server with username sa_merac (Password is NOT the same, also in LastPass under notes)


On the desktop there is now a batch file:



Run and wait for the process to complete:



Login to the web portal, the script will open this for you:




Update Templates and Images & Data:



Let the Steam team know the images are now up to date.

title: How ‘Apportion Multibuy Discounts’ Affects The Daily Transaction Analysis
text: Hi Might be useful if anyone ever asks how the system option of ‘Apportion Multibuy Discounts’ affects the DTA. The bit that is relevant starts at the yellow highlighted line ?. I also used a Multi-buy promotion with deal groups that I had never used and it did work. Rather than a multibuy triggering on the same item only, then this works to set up a multi-buy to trigger on a range of items (PLUs). Be aware of the ‘Allow multibuy within analysis codes’ flag as I had not set this so the promotion failed to trigger when I first tested. Also be aware of the ‘Apply to lowest priced item first’ tick box as most customer would typically want this set. Harry and Rich not sure if you want to pass this internally to MStore support colleagues or add to your own knowledge base? Regards Adam Ayres From: Adam Ayres Sent: 04 January 2024 15:24 To: Kim Oeillet ; Ian Osborne ; Will Highfield Subject: Jersey Zoo - Post Training / Consultancy Queries Hello Kim After the consultancy session today I did a quick test on the promotion and I realised there is one thing you will need to do to make the promotion work (as I do not think it is ticked as standard) On the promotion you set up I think all the items were in the SAME Analysis Code, if so this box needs to BE TICKED for the promotion to work (otherwise the PLUs would need to be in separate Analysis Codes for the promotion to work). With the promotion set to also ‘Apply to lowest item first’ on the testing I did this all worked as expected and triggered the promotion on the lowest priced item when 3 different priced items were sold (one at £1, £2 and £3 respectively). But please test thoroughly using your own data. The below was more to answer Ian’s question about how multibuy discounts are apportioned and I ran some tests (after selling 3 items at £1, £2 and £3) with the promotion set to discount the lowest item. Below is the effect on the ‘Daily Transaction Analysis Report’ with the System Option ‘Apportion Multibuy Discounts’ Discounts ON Below is the effect on the ‘Daily Transaction Analysis Report’ with the System Option ‘Apportion Multibuy Discounts’ OFF Please note the System Option is found in Setup > System > System Options by clicking the ‘Accounting’ tab and ticking/unticking the option to be as required then click ‘Apply’ to save the change. I hope the above clarifies your queries re multibuy functionality and reporting where you wanted 3 items from a range of items to be sold in a promotion, where the cheapest item needs to be discounted. But as ever I would always test with your own data to make sure you are happy Concerning the cost price changes not updating then this would be an issue that needs to be raised with support as a ticket (if not done so already) they can investigate further and ask the developers to assist if needed. I know when using the Stock Adjustments screen (which is not the same as the purchase order system) then the latest and average costs only (not the standard) will be updated to the stock record when the cost is changed. However I was under the impression this would also happen (i.e. the latest and average costs only, not the standard) will be updated when the cost on a Purchase Order is updated. Now only support could confirm with the developers what is supposed to happen when the costs in a Purchase Order are amended. They would just need one example Purchase Order where the cost was changed and the cost in the corresponding stock item latest and / or average price was not updated. Regards Adam Ayres MStore Consultant Tel: +44 1392 829761 www.k3btg.com
description:
Hi

 

Might be useful if anyone ever asks how the system option of ‘Apportion Multibuy Discounts’ affects the DTA. The bit that is relevant starts at the yellow highlighted line ?.

 

I also used a Multi-buy promotion with deal groups that I had never used and it did work. Rather than a multibuy triggering on the same item only, then this works to set up a multi-buy to trigger on a range of items (PLUs).

 

Be aware of the ‘Allow multibuy within analysis codes’ flag as I had not set this so the promotion failed to trigger when I first tested. Also be aware of the ‘Apply to lowest priced item first’ tick box as most customer would typically want this set.

 

Harry and Rich not sure if you want to pass this internally to MStore support colleagues or add to your own knowledge base?

Regards

Adam Ayres
 

 

From: Adam Ayres
Sent: 04 January 2024 15:24
To: Kim Oeillet <Kim.Oeillet@durrell.org>; Ian Osborne <Ian.Osborne@durrell.org>; Will Highfield <Will.Highfield@durrell.org>
Subject: Jersey Zoo - Post Training / Consultancy Queries

 

Hello Kim

 

After the consultancy session today I did a quick test on the  promotion and I realised there is one thing you will need to do to make the promotion work (as I do not think it is ticked as standard)

 

 

On the promotion you set up I think all the items were in the SAME Analysis Code, if so this box needs to BE TICKED for the promotion to work (otherwise the PLUs would need to be in separate Analysis Codes for the promotion to work).

 

With the promotion set to also ‘Apply to lowest item first’ on the testing I did this all worked as expected and triggered the promotion on the lowest priced item when 3 different priced items were sold (one at £1, £2 and £3 respectively). But please test thoroughly using your own data.

 

 

The below was more to answer Ian’s question about how multibuy discounts are apportioned and I ran some tests (after selling 3 items at £1, £2 and £3) with the promotion set to discount the lowest item.

 

Below is the effect on the ‘Daily Transaction Analysis Report’ with the System Option ‘Apportion Multibuy Discounts’ Discounts ON

 

 

 

Below is the effect on the ‘Daily Transaction Analysis Report’ with the System Option ‘Apportion Multibuy Discounts’ OFF

 

 

 

Please note the System Option is found in Setup > System > System Options by clicking the ‘Accounting’ tab and ticking/unticking the option to be as required then click ‘Apply’ to save the change.

 

I hope the above clarifies your queries re multibuy functionality and reporting where you wanted 3 items from a range of items to be sold in a promotion, where the cheapest item needs to be discounted. But as ever I would always test with your own data to make sure you are happy

Concerning the cost price changes not updating then this would be an issue that needs to be raised with support as a ticket (if not done so already) they can investigate further and ask the developers to assist if needed. I know when using the Stock Adjustments screen (which is not the same as the purchase order system) then the latest and average costs only (not the standard) will be updated to the stock record when the cost is changed. However I was under the impression this would also happen (i.e. the latest and average costs only, not the standard) will be updated when the cost on a Purchase Order is updated. Now only support could confirm with the developers what is supposed to happen when the costs in a Purchase Order are amended. They would just need one example Purchase Order where the cost was changed and the cost in the corresponding stock item latest and / or average price was not updated.

Regards

Adam Ayres
 MStore Consultant

Tel: +44 1392 829761

www.k3btg.com

title: Internet Vouchers
text: Refund Resource: This is only required / used for a ‘Reduce Basket’ type promotion. Is used to assign the discount amount to a single PLU (Refund resource) rather than taking a proportion off each individual PLU. Use Once: Relates to not being able to use the same code in a transaction more than once. The exact outcome being it discounts one item once rather than the entire basket. The code can be used many times on different transactions/bookings. Single Use: This will keep track if a code has been used and not to be used again. Ability to clone a promotion and generate X Number of codes. These can then be exported to Excel. They are grouped by the cloned original, so it doesn’t fill the form. -- Single Use was added in May 2023, if the website was created before this point it will require an update to allow this functionality to work.
description:
Refund Resource: This is only required / used for a ‘Reduce Basket’ type promotion. Is used to assign the discount amount to a single PLU (Refund resource) rather than taking a proportion off each individual PLU. 
 
Use Once: Relates to not being able to use the same code in a transaction more than once. The exact outcome being it discounts one item once rather than the entire basket. The code can be used many times on different transactions/bookings. 

Single Use: This will keep track if a code has been used and not to be used again.  Ability to clone a promotion and generate X Number of codes. These can then be exported to Excel. They are grouped by the cloned original, so it doesn’t fill the form.


-- Single Use was added in May 2023, if the website was created before this point it will require an update to allow this functionality to work.

title: Enable Kitchen Order Debug Logging On MStore Tills
text: If a customer is having issues with kitchen orders not sending to their kitchen printer, or there has been a hours/days delay in the kitchen order from printing, you will need to setup kitchen orders debug logging. You will first need to have the customers MStore version on 3.18.4 or higher. After this, you need to insert LOGDEBUG=1 into the MStore.ini file of the tills that you would like to record logs of. This can be inserted anywhere on its own line below the server line.
description:
If a customer is having issues with kitchen orders not sending to their kitchen printer, or there has been a hours/days delay in the kitchen order from printing, you will need to setup kitchen orders debug logging.


You will first need to have the customers MStore version on 3.18.4 or higher. After this, you need to insert LOGDEBUG=1 into the MStore.ini file of the tills that you would like to record logs of. This can be inserted anywhere on its own line below the server line.

text: You can find the various status flags throughout the MStore system here. If you find any more, please add another table. Y ?? Reservation Enquiry OrderHeader OrhStatus Description 1 Entered 2 Internet Entered 3 Locked 4 Partial Delivery 5 On Hold 6 Cancelled 7 Completed 8 Awaiting Payment Booking Types (BKGHeader) bkhType Description 1 Group 2 Birthday Party 3 School Booking 4 Internet Booking TillDefinitions POS Layout codes for resolutions Number Resolution 1 320x240 2 640x480 3 800x600 4 1024x768 5 1280x800 6 800x1280 7 1366x768

title: Changing Datasource Location In Crystal Reports
text: If you would like to change the datasource location on a Crystal report, due to creating a new report, which references a new stored procedure, please follow below. Click Database, Set Datasource Location. Choose new location. Then righthand side of main screen, under Database Fields, right-click on the stored procedure name, and click Database Expert... Right click on the stored procedure in Selected Tables, and press Rename. Rename to the new stored procedure name. Click OK. Click Database, and verify database. Tick NULL for all of them, and then save the report and you are done.
description:
If you would like to change the datasource location on a Crystal report, due to creating a new report, which references a new stored procedure, please follow below.


Click Database, Set Datasource Location. Choose new location. Then righthand side of main screen, under Database Fields, right-click on the stored procedure name, and click Database Expert... 



Right click on the stored procedure in Selected Tables, and press Rename. Rename to the new stored procedure name. Click OK. Click Database, and verify database. Tick NULL for all of them, and then save the report and you are done.

title: Deleting Duplicated And Doubled Up Barcodes
text: If you would like to remove duplicate barcodes (different barcode records with the same barcode) and doubled up barcodes (barcode records that are using two different barcodes for the same item), then you can follow the below steps to perform this. --Back up database --1. Create duplicated barcodes table ;WITH cte AS ( SELECT bcdId, bcdCode, ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY bcdCode ORDER BY BarCodes.Deleted ASC, bcdId ASC) AS rn FROM BarCodes WHERE bcdCode IN (SELECT bcdCode FROM BarCodes GROUP BY bcdCode HAVING COUNT(bcdcode)>1) ) SELECT cte.bcdCode [Barcode], MAX(CASE WHEN cte.rn = 1 THEN cte.bcdId END) AS [MasterBarcodeID], MAX(CASE WHEN cte.rn = 2 THEN cte.bcdId END) AS [1stDuplicateBarcodeIDRemoved], MAX(CASE WHEN cte.rn = 3 THEN cte.bcdId END) AS [2ndDuplicateBarcodeIDRemoved], MAX(CASE WHEN cte.rn = 4 THEN cte.bcdId END) AS [3rdDuplicateBarcodeIDRemoved] INTO DuplicateBarcodes FROM cte JOIN BarCodes ON cte.bcdId = BarCodes.bcdId GROUP BY cte.bcdCode -- (24 rows affected) --2. Backup Relevant Tables SELECT * INTO BAKBarCodes06AUG2024 FROM BarCodes SELECT * INTO BAKTXNDetail06AUG2024 FROM TXNDetail SELECT * INTO BAKOrderDetail06AUG2024 FROM OrderDetail SELECT * INTO BAKPOrderDet06AUG2024 FROM POrderDet SELECT * INTO BAKStockTakeDet06AUG2024 FROM StockTakeDet /*(4950 rows affected) (1294259 rows affected) (726 rows affected) (2382 rows affected) (9757 rows affected)*/ -- 3. description:
If you would like to remove duplicate barcodes (different barcode records with the same barcode) and doubled up barcodes (barcode records that are using two different barcodes for the same item), then you can follow the below steps to perform this.




--Back up database

--1. Create duplicated barcodes table


;WITH cte AS 

( 

    SELECT 

        bcdId, 

        bcdCode, 

        ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY bcdCode ORDER BY BarCodes.Deleted ASC, bcdId ASC) AS rn 

    FROM  

        BarCodes

    WHERE bcdCode IN (SELECT bcdCode FROM BarCodes 

                      GROUP BY bcdCode

                      HAVING COUNT(bcdcode)>1)

)

SELECT 

    cte.bcdCode [Barcode],

    MAX(CASE WHEN cte.rn = 1 THEN cte.bcdId END) AS [MasterBarcodeID],

    MAX(CASE WHEN cte.rn = 2 THEN cte.bcdId END) AS [1stDuplicateBarcodeIDRemoved],

    MAX(CASE WHEN cte.rn = 3 THEN cte.bcdId END) AS [2ndDuplicateBarcodeIDRemoved],

    MAX(CASE WHEN cte.rn = 4 THEN cte.bcdId END) AS [3rdDuplicateBarcodeIDRemoved]

INTO DuplicateBarcodes

FROM cte 

JOIN 

    BarCodes ON cte.bcdId = BarCodes.bcdId

GROUP BY cte.bcdCode


-- (24 rows affected)


--2. Backup Relevant Tables


SELECT * INTO BAKBarCodes06AUG2024 FROM BarCodes

SELECT * INTO BAKTXNDetail06AUG2024 FROM TXNDetail

SELECT * INTO BAKOrderDetail06AUG2024 FROM OrderDetail

SELECT * INTO BAKPOrderDet06AUG2024 FROM POrderDet

SELECT * INTO BAKStockTakeDet06AUG2024 FROM StockTakeDet


/*(4950 rows affected)


(1294259 rows affected)


(726 rows affected)


(2382 rows affected)


(9757 rows affected)*/



-- 3. Delete Duplicate Barcodes


BEGIN TRANSACTION 

UPDATE TXNDetail

SET txnBCDId=a.bcdId

FROM BarCodes a

JOIN BarCodes b ON a.bcdCode=b.bcdCode AND a.bcdId<>b.bcdId

JOIN TXNDetail ON b.bcdId=txnBCDId

WHERE a.BCDId IN (SELECT MasterBarcodeID FROM DuplicateBarcodes)

--COMMIT 


--(51 rows affected)


BEGIN TRANSACTION 

UPDATE OrderDetail

SET ordBCDId=a.bcdId

FROM BarCodes a

JOIN BarCodes b ON a.bcdCode=b.bcdCode AND a.bcdId<>b.bcdId

JOIN OrderDetail ON b.bcdId=ordBCDId

WHERE a.BCDId IN (SELECT MasterBarcodeID FROM DuplicateBarcodes)

--COMMIT 


--(0 rows affected)


BEGIN TRANSACTION 

UPDATE POrderDet

SET podBCDId=a.bcdId

FROM BarCodes a

JOIN BarCodes b ON a.bcdCode=b.bcdCode AND a.bcdId<>b.bcdId

JOIN POrderDet ON b.bcdId=podBCDId

WHERE a.BCDId IN (SELECT MasterBarcodeID FROM DuplicateBarcodes)

--COMMIT 


--(14 rows affected)


BEGIN TRANSACTION 

UPDATE StockTakeDet

SET stdBCDID=a.bcdId

FROM BarCodes a

JOIN BarCodes b ON a.bcdCode=b.bcdCode AND a.bcdId<>b.bcdId

JOIN StockTakeDet ON b.bcdId=stdBCDID

WHERE a.BCDId IN (SELECT MasterBarcodeID FROM DuplicateBarcodes)

--COMMIT 


--(6 rows affected)


BEGIN TRANSACTION 

DELETE FROM BarCodes

WHERE bcdId IN (SELECT b.bcdId FROM BarCodes a

JOIN BarCodes b ON a.bcdCode=b.bcdCode AND a.bcdId<>b.bcdId

WHERE a.bcdId IN (SELECT MasterBarcodeID FROM DuplicateBarcodes))

--COMMIT 

rollback


--(30 rows affected)


--SELECT * FROM DuplicateBarcodes


--SELECT * FROM BarCodes

--WHERE bcdId IN (SELECT MasterBarcodeID FROM DuplicateBarcodes)


-- 4. Create Doubled Up Barcodes Table


;WITH cte AS 

( 

    SELECT 

        bcdPLURecNo, 

        bcdCode, 

        ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY bcdPLURecNo ORDER BY LEN(bcdCode) DESC) AS rn 

    FROM  

        BarCodes

    WHERE 

        --BarCodes.Deleted = 0 AND

        bcdPLURecNo IN (SELECT bcdPLURecNo FROM BarCodes

                                --WHERE BarCodes.Deleted = 0 

                            GROUP BY bcdPLURecNo

                            HAVING COUNT(bcdPLURecNo) = 2)

) 

SELECT 

    pluShortDesc [PLUShortDescription],

    MAX(CASE WHEN cte.rn = 1 THEN cte.bcdCode END) AS [MasterBarcode],

    MAX(CASE WHEN cte.rn = 2 THEN cte.bcdCode END) AS [BarcodeRemoved]

INTO DoubledUpBarcodes

FROM cte 

JOIN 

    BarCodes ON cte.bcdPLURecNo = BarCodes.bcdPLURecNo

JOIN 

    PriceLookups ON cte.bcdPLURecNo=pluRecNo

GROUP BY 

    pluShortDesc

HAVING 

    LEFT(MAX(CASE WHEN cte.rn = 1 THEN cte.bcdCode END),4) <> LEFT(MAX(CASE WHEN cte.rn = 2 THEN cte.bcdCode END),4) 

    AND RIGHT(MAX(CASE WHEN cte.rn = 1 THEN cte.bcdCode END),4) <> RIGHT(MAX(CASE WHEN cte.rn = 2 THEN cte.bcdCode END),4);


--(1079 rows affected)


-- 5. Backup Relevant Tables


SELECT * INTO BAKBarCodes06AUG2024a FROM BarCodes

SELECT * INTO BAKTXNDetail06AUG2024a FROM TXNDetail

SELECT * INTO BAKOrderDetail06AUG2024a FROM OrderDetail

SELECT * INTO BAKPOrderDet06AUG2024a FROM POrderDet

SELECT * INTO BAKStockTakeDet06AUG2024a FROM StockTakeDet


/*(4920 rows affected)


(1294267 rows affected)


(726 rows affected)


(2383 rows affected)


(9757 rows affected)*/


-- 6. Delete Duplicate Barcodes


BEGIN TRANSACTION 

UPDATE TXNDetail

SET txnBCDId=a.bcdId

FROM BarCodes a

JOIN BarCodes b ON a.bcdPLURecNo=b.bcdPLURecNo AND a.bcdCode<>b.bcdCode

JOIN TXNDetail ON b.bcdId=txnBCDId

WHERE a.bcdCode IN (SELECT MasterBarcode FROM DoubledUpBarcodes)

--COMMIT 


--(2278 rows affected)


BEGIN TRANSACTION 

UPDATE OrderDetail

SET ordBCDId=a.bcdId

FROM BarCodes a

JOIN BarCodes b ON a.bcdPLURecNo=b.bcdPLURecNo AND a.bcdCode<>b.bcdCode

JOIN OrderDetail ON b.bcdId=ordBCDId

WHERE a.bcdCode IN (SELECT MasterBarcode FROM DoubledUpBarcodes)

--COMMIT 


--(102 rows affected)


BEGIN TRANSACTION 

UPDATE POrderDet

SET podBCDId=a.bcdId

FROM BarCodes a

JOIN BarCodes b ON a.bcdPLURecNo=b.bcdPLURecNo AND a.bcdCode<>b.bcdCode

JOIN POrderDet ON b.bcdId=podBCDId

WHERE a.bcdCode IN (SELECT MasterBarcode FROM DoubledUpBarcodes)

--COMMIT 


--(519 rows affected)


BEGIN TRANSACTION 

UPDATE StockTakeDet

SET stdBCDID=a.bcdId

FROM BarCodes a

JOIN BarCodes b ON a.bcdPLURecNo=b.bcdPLURecNo AND a.bcdCode<>b.bcdCode

JOIN StockTakeDet ON b.bcdId=stdBCDID

WHERE a.bcdCode IN (SELECT MasterBarcode FROM DoubledUpBarcodes)

--COMMIT 


--(322 rows affected)


BEGIN TRANSACTION 

DELETE FROM BarCodes

WHERE bcdId IN (SELECT b.bcdId FROM BarCodes a

JOIN BarCodes b ON a.bcdPLURecNo=b.bcdPLURecNo AND a.bcdCode<>b.bcdCode

WHERE a.bcdCode IN (SELECT MasterBarcode FROM DoubledUpBarcodes))

--COMMIT


--(1079 rows affected)



-- 8. Removing requested doubled up barcodes from Ian


SELECT * INTO BAKBarCodes06AUG2024b FROM BarCodes

SELECT * INTO BAKTXNDetail06AUG2024b FROM TXNDetail

SELECT * INTO BAKOrderDetail06AUG2024b FROM OrderDetail

SELECT * INTO BAKPOrderDet06AUG2024b FROM POrderDet

SELECT * INTO BAKStockTakeDet06AUG2024b FROM StockTakeDet


CREATE TABLE BarcodeRemoval (

[BarcodeToRemove] VARCHAR(25),

[CorrectBarcode] VARCHAR(25)

);

--


SELECT * FROM BarcodeRemoval

LEFT JOIN BarCodes a ON BarcodeToRemove=a.bcdCode

LEFT JOIN BarCodes b ON CorrectBarcode=b.bcdCode



BEGIN TRANSACTION 

UPDATE TXNDetail

SET txnBCDId=a.bcdId

FROM BarCodes a

JOIN BarcodeRemoval ON a.bcdCode=CorrectBarcode

JOIN BarCodes b ON b.bcdCode=BarcodeToRemove AND a.bcdCode<>b.bcdCode

JOIN TXNDetail ON b.bcdId=txnBCDId

--COMMIT

BEGIN TRANSACTION 

UPDATE OrderDetail

SET ordBCDId=a.bcdId

FROM BarCodes a

JOIN BarcodeRemoval ON a.bcdCode=CorrectBarcode

JOIN BarCodes b ON b.bcdCode=BarcodeToRemove AND a.bcdCode<>b.bcdCode

JOIN OrderDetail ON b.bcdId=ordBCDId

--COMMIT

UPDATE POrderDet

SET podBCDId=a.bcdId

FROM BarCodes a

JOIN BarcodeRemoval ON a.bcdCode=CorrectBarcode

JOIN BarCodes b ON b.bcdCode=BarcodeToRemove AND a.bcdCode<>b.bcdCode

JOIN POrderDet ON b.bcdId=podBCDId

--COMMIT

FROM BarCodes a

JOIN BarCodes b ON b.bcdCode=BarcodeToRemove AND a.bcdCode<>b.bcdCode

JOIN StockTakeDet ON b.bcdId=stdBCDID

--COMMIT 


--(3 rows affected)

title: Do Not Create Till 999 Licence In MStore Database
text: Do not create/leave a till 999 licence in the database, as this breaks the system to be able to show switch panel information when configuring the buttons, as was discovered in ticket: https://support.k3btg.com/helpdesk/tickets/60269.
description: Do not create/leave a till 999 licence in the database, as this breaks the system to be able to show switch panel information when configuring the buttons, as was discovered in ticket: https://support.k3btg.com/helpdesk/tickets/60269.

title: Notes When Importing Data Using Excel
text: If you are importing name data, make sure you double up an apostrophes, so they are inserted into the system as an apostrophe and doesn't break your import. Also make sure you use a long date format, so UK dates aren't interpretted as American. This can be done by changing the date column to the chosen date format (dd mmm yyyy preferably), copy this column into Notepad. Then change the date column in Excel to Text format, then paste the dates from the notepad back into Excel. This needs to be done when making SQL statements in Excel, as Excel re-formats dates to a number when referenced.
description:
If you are importing name data, make sure you double up an apostrophes, so they are inserted into the system as an apostrophe and doesn't break your import.


Also make sure you use a long date format, so UK dates aren't interpretted  as American. This can be done by changing the date column  to the chosen date format  (dd mmm yyyy preferably), copy this column into Notepad. Then change the date column in Excel to Text format, then paste the dates from the notepad back into Excel.


This needs to be done when making SQL statements in Excel, as Excel re-formats dates to a number when referenced.

title: Blank Box When Using User Defined Payment Method For The First Time
text: If a new user defined payment method is created and used on the POS, but am getting the below blank box, then import this format file attached into the Back Office. You will then need to add the Num Pad Large on the black box on this screen in the POS for each layout and recreate till data before going back to the customer to confirm this is now sorted.
description:
If a new user defined payment method is created and used on the POS, but am getting the below blank box, then import this format file attached into the Back Office.



You will then need to add the Num Pad Large on the black box on this screen in the POS  for each layout and recreate till data before going back to the customer to confirm this is now sorted.

title: Opening & Closing Records For MACScanner Transactions
text: Internet and MACScanner transactions don't get sent with opening and closing records, as then the external processes would have to check on every transaction whether a cash drawer has been open for the day. The simplest way we do this is Internet and MACScanner transactions get sent to the database. Then there are specific stored procedures that decide when a cash drawer needs to be opened (when the first transaction is inserted into the database) and closed (at midnight).
description: Internet and MACScanner transactions don't get sent with opening and closing records, as then the external processes would have to check on every transaction whether a cash drawer has been open for the day. The simplest way we do this is Internet and MACScanner transactions get sent to the database. Then there are specific stored procedures that decide when a cash drawer needs to be opened (when the first transaction is inserted into the database) and closed (at midnight).

title: Produce Power BI File For Distribution To Customers
text: If you have a Power BI model that you want to distribute to customers, you will want to make sure you remove any links to the current server and database details. To do this, in the Home ribbon, go the drop-down on Transform data, then go to Data source settings. Then select each data source and put a placeholder in place for each field that requires data. Then Click Ok. Please Note: Make sure some sort of file path is inserted, otherwise Power BI will remove this from the data source list. Then go to save the file as a Power BI template file (.pbit).
description:
If you have a Power BI model that you want to distribute to customers, you will want to make sure you remove any links to the current server and database details. To do this, in the Home ribbon, go the drop-down on Transform data, then go to Data source settings.


Then select each data source and put a placeholder in place for each field that requires data. Then Click Ok.

Please Note: Make sure some sort of file path is inserted, otherwise Power BI will remove this from the data source list.



Then go to save the file as a Power BI template file (.pbit).
